title: 105_s1370
content: The Act titled "Social Security Family Protection Act" amends the Social Security Act to include provisions for the computation and payment of the last monthly insurance benefit terminated by death. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends the Social Security Act to include provisions for the last payment of monthly insurance benefits terminated by death, specifying the amount and method of payment. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends the Social Security Act to include provisions for the last payment of monthly insurance benefits terminated by death, specifying the amount and method of payment as outlined in the text. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends the Social Security Act to include provisions for the last payment of monthly insurance benefits terminated by death, specifying the amount and method of payment as outlined in the text. The amount of the benefit paid for the month of death is 50 percent of the original benefit amount, rounded down to the nearest dollar. This payment is made in accordance with section 204(d) of the Act. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends the Social Security Act to modify old-age and wife's insurance benefits, including changes to the payment structure and designations within the Act. The Social Security Family Protection Act makes amendments to old-age and wife's insurance benefits under the Social Security Act, including changes to payment structure and designations. This includes modifications to husband's and child's insurance benefits, such as redesignating subparagraphs and conforming amendments. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends child's, widow's, and widower's insurance benefits under the Social Security Act by changing the ending month provisions for when the beneficiary dies or remarries. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends provisions for widower's, mother's, father's, and parent's insurance benefits under the Social Security Act regarding the ending month provisions for remarriage or death of the beneficiary. The Social Security Family Protection Act amends provisions for parent's insurance benefits under the Social Security Act, changing the ending month provisions for remarriage or death of the beneficiary. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust benefits for uninsured individuals at age 72 and exempt certain individuals from the maximum benefit cap. Exemption from maximum benefit cap for certain individuals receiving specific amounts under different sections. Effective date for amendments applies to deaths occurring 180 days after enactment of the Act.
